get.summary: Retrieves all saved addresses for a specific user.

post.summary: Creates a new address for a user.
Initiates the password reset process by sending an OTP to the user's email.
post.description:
This endpoint sends a One-Time Password (OTP) to the provided email address
if the user exists. For security reasons, it returns success even if the user
doesn't exist to prevent email enumeration attacks.

requestBody.description: The email address for password reset

200.description: OTP sent successfully (or user not found - same response for security)

post.summary: Resets the user's password using the OTP code sent to their email.
post.description:
This endpoint verifies the OTP code and updates the user's password.
After successful password reset, all existing refresh tokens are revoked
for security purposes, requiring the user to log in again.

requestBody.description: Contains email, OTP code, and new password

post.summary: Request a One-Time Password (OTP) for a specific purpose.
post.description:
OTP purposes supported: `Login`, `PasswordReset`, `EmailVerification`, `Payment`.  
- If the purpose is `Login`, a JWT token is returned along with a refresh token.
 provide `Email`  identify the user.  
If the user does not exist, the endpoint returns `404 Not Found`.

requestBody.description: DTO containing the user's email or phone number and the OTP purpose.

400.description: Invalid request (missing purpose or invalid data).

post.summary: Verify a previously requested OTP.
post.description:
Provide the OTP code, purpose, and either Email or PhoneNumber.  
OTP purposes supported: `Login`, `PasswordReset`, `EmailVerification`, `Payment`.  
- If the purpose is `Login`, a JWT token is returned along with a refresh token.
- Returns 400 if the OTP is invalid or expired.
- Returns 404 if the user does not exist.

requestBody.description: DTO containing the user's email/phone, OTP code, and purpose.

post.summary: Registers a new user using email and password.
post.description:
Creates a new account and returns authentication tokens.
The email must not already be registered.

requestBody.description: Registration details including name, email, and password.

400.description: Email already exists or invalid data.

post.summary: Authenticates a user using email and password.
post.description: Returns JWT access and refresh tokens if credentials are valid.

post.summary: Generates a new access token using a valid refresh token.
post.description:
This endpoint allows users to stay authenticated without re-entering credentials.
The refresh token must not be expired or revoked.

post.summary: Revokes a refresh token (logs the user out).
post.description:
This endpoint removes the refresh token from the database,
preventing it from being used again.

post.summary: Authenticates a user using Google Sign-In.
post.description: If the email does not exist, a new account is automatically created.

post.summary: Creates a new product
post.description:
Creates a new product in the system. The seller ID is automatically assigned from the authenticated user.

Sample request:

    POST /api/product
    {
        "categoryId": 1,
        "name": "Wireless Mouse",
        "description": "Ergonomic wireless mouse with USB receiver",
        "price": 29.99,
        "stock": 100,
        "imageUrl": "https://example.com/images/mouse.jpg"
    }

400.description: If the product data is invalid or an error occurs

401.description: If the user is not authenticated

403.description: If the user doesn't have seller or admin role

put.description:
Updates product information. Only the product owner or an admin can update a product.
All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated.

Sample request:

    PUT /api/product/5
    {
        "name": "Updated Product Name",
        "price": 39.99,
        "stock": 150
    }

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the product to update

400.description: If an error occurs during update

post.summary: Request an email verification OTP.
post.description:
Sends a verification OTP code to the user's email address.  
OTP purposes supported: `EmailVerification`.  
- Returns 400 if the email is missing or invalid.  
- An existing active OTP will be invalidated and replaced with a new one.

post.summary: Verify an email verification OTP.
post.description:
Confirms a previously requested email verification OTP.  
- Requires the OTP code and the user's email address.  
- Marks the user's email as verified upon success.  
- Returns 400 if the OTP is incorrect or expired.  
- Returns 404 if the user does not exist.
